segment.source: Devices can automatically scan for updates, download them, and prompt the user to install them at a time that’s right for them.
segment.target: Devices can automatically scan for updates, download them, and prompt the user to install them at a time that’s right for them.

segment.source: They can also identify updates that are too important to pass by.
segment.target: They can also identify updates that are too important to pass by.

segment.source: Scan, download, and install updates
segment.target: Scan, download, and install updates

segment.source: Scan, download, and install updates
segment.target: Scan, download, and install updates

segment.source: Devices can automatically scan for updates, download them, and prompt the user to install them at a time that’s right for them.
segment.target: Devices can automatically scan for updates, download them, and prompt the user to install them at a time that’s right for them.

segment.source: They can also identify updates that are too important to pass by.
segment.target: They can also identify updates that are too important to pass by.

segment.source: Normal, strongly suggested, and mandatory updates
segment.target: Normal, strongly suggested, and mandatory updates

segment.source: Some users don’t want to be bothered by updates.
segment.target: Some users don’t want to be bothered by updates.

segment.source: If they don’t know if they’re important, they may postpone them indefinitely.
segment.target: If they don’t know if they’re important, they may postpone them indefinitely.

segment.source: To help identify important updates, mark them as strongly suggested updates (SSU) or mandatory updates by opening a Team Foundation Server (TFS) Update request and marking this in the notes.
segment.target: To help identify important updates, mark them as strongly suggested updates (SSU) or mandatory updates by opening a Team Foundation Server (TFS) Update request and marking this in the notes.

segment.source: We’ll set this up on the Windows Update server.
segment.target: We’ll set this up on the Windows Update server.

segment.source: Detecting updates
segment.target: Detecting updates

segment.source: By default, the device regularly checks for updates.
segment.target: By default, the device regularly checks for updates.

segment.source: This process occurs in the background and does not interrupt the use of the device.
segment.target: This process occurs in the background and does not interrupt the use of the device.

segment.source: The automatic scan occurs on the following schedule:
segment.target: The automatic scan occurs on the following schedule:

segment.source: Every 6.2 days when on a cellular connection.
segment.target: Every 6.2 days when on a cellular connection.

segment.source: This will trigger up to one day earlier if a Wi-Fi connection is available.
segment.target: This will trigger up to one day earlier if a Wi-Fi connection is available.

segment.source: Every day when the device is on AC power and when the user is not actively using the device.
segment.target: Every day when the device is on AC power and when the user is not actively using the device.

segment.source: Each time the device is rebooted, the scan starts 60 minutes after boot is complete.
segment.target: Each time the device is rebooted, the scan starts 60 minutes after boot is complete.

segment.source: The automatic scan uses either a Wi-Fi or a cellular connection:
segment.target: The automatic scan uses either a Wi-Fi or a cellular connection:

segment.source: For the first scan, the device scans when either a Wi-Fi or a cellular connection is available.
segment.target: For the first scan, the device scans when either a Wi-Fi or a cellular connection is available.

segment.source: For the first scan after a successful update, the device scans when either a Wi-Fi or a cellular connection is available.
segment.target: For the first scan after a successful update, the device scans when either a Wi-Fi or a cellular connection is available.

segment.source: If time since previous scan is less than 6.2 days, the phone will only scan if a Wi-Fi connection is available.
segment.target: If time since previous scan is less than 6.2 days, the phone will only scan if a Wi-Fi connection is available.

segment.source: If time since previous scan is 6.2 days or more, the phone will scan if either a Wi-Fi or a cellular connection is available.
segment.target: If time since previous scan is 6.2 days or more, the phone will scan if either a Wi-Fi or a cellular connection is available.

segment.source: After an update completes, the device reboots and performs another immediate scan for updates.
segment.target: After an update completes, the device reboots and performs another immediate scan for updates.

segment.source: Users can enable or disable automatic scan in the Phone update menu: Tell me when updates are available for my phone.
segment.target: Users can enable or disable automatic scan in the Phone update menu: Tell me when updates are available for my phone.

segment.source: By default, this setting is not visible, and the default setting is checked.
segment.target: By default, this setting is not visible, and the default setting is checked.

segment.source: OEMs can change whether the setting is visible, and change its default setting.
segment.target: OEMs can change whether the setting is visible, and change its default setting.

segment.source: Users can use the phone update menu to manually check for updates and track the progress of updates.
segment.target: Users can use the phone update menu to manually check for updates and track the progress of updates.

segment.source: Downloading updates
segment.target: Downloading updates

segment.source: By default, if the device is on a Wi-Fi connection, the update downloads automatically.
segment.target: By default, if the device is on a Wi-Fi connection, the update downloads automatically.

segment.source: If automatic downloading isn’t checked, or if the device is on a cellular connection, then the device may prompt the user to download the update:
segment.target: If automatic downloading isn’t checked, or if the device is on a cellular connection, then the device may prompt the user to download the update:

segment.source: For cellular connections, if the device checks to see if the size of the update is less than the update size limit.
segment.target: For cellular connections, if the device checks to see if the size of the update is less than the update size limit.

segment.source: The default size is 100 MB, configurable by the MO.
segment.target: The default size is 100 MB, configurable by the MO.

segment.source: If the device is under the limit, they’ll be prompted with an option to download the update using their cellular connection.
segment.target: If the device is under the limit, they’ll be prompted with an option to download the update using their cellular connection.

segment.source: If the user chooses to download the update over their cellular connection, the user may be charged for that data depending on their data plan with their MO.
segment.target: If the user chooses to download the update over their cellular connection, the user may be charged for that data depending on their data plan with their MO.

segment.source: The MO can configure updates to be free of charge to the user.
segment.target: The MO can configure updates to be free of charge to the user.

segment.source: To learn more, see Enable zero-rating (no-charge) downloads for device updates.
segment.target: To learn more, see Enable zero-rating (no-charge) downloads for device updates.

segment.source: If they postpone the download, it will prompt them later:
segment.target: If they postpone the download, it will prompt them later:

segment.source: Normal updates: Prompts every 27 hours.
segment.target: Normal updates: Prompts every 27 hours.

segment.source: Strongly suggested updates: Prompts every 27 hours for 3 retries.
segment.target: Strongly suggested updates: Prompts every 27 hours for 3 retries.

segment.source: After that, it prompts every 4 hours.
segment.target: After that, it prompts every 4 hours.

segment.source: Mandatory updates: Prompts every 4 hours.
segment.target: Mandatory updates: Prompts every 4 hours.

segment.source: If there is an unrecoverable error during the download (such as insufficient space), the update keeps retrying.
segment.target: If there is an unrecoverable error during the download (such as insufficient space), the update keeps retrying.

segment.source: For critical errors, the update stage goes back to scan for updates and starts again.
segment.target: For critical errors, the update stage goes back to scan for updates and starts again.

segment.source: Users can enable or disable the automatic download in the Phone update menu: Automatically download updates if my data settings allow it.
segment.target: Users can enable or disable the automatic download in the Phone update menu: Automatically download updates if my data settings allow it.

segment.source: The default setting is checked.
segment.target: The default setting is checked.

segment.source: OEMs cannot change the default.
segment.target: OEMs cannot change the default.

segment.source: After the update has successfully downloaded the update, the device validates it and stages it for installation.
segment.target: After the update has successfully downloaded the update, the device validates it and stages it for installation.

segment.source: Dealing with multiple updates at once
segment.target: Dealing with multiple updates at once

segment.source: If there’s any preceding updates that require a full reboot (hard stop) of the device, it deals with those updates first.
segment.target: If there’s any preceding updates that require a full reboot (hard stop) of the device, it deals with those updates first.

segment.source: If there’s more than one update pending, and if any of those updates are strongly suggested updates, and if none of those updates require a reboot, it treats them all as one big update, so the user can accept them all at once.
segment.target: If there’s more than one update pending, and if any of those updates are strongly suggested updates, and if none of those updates require a reboot, it treats them all as one big update, so the user can accept them all at once.

segment.source: Installing an update
segment.target: Installing an update

segment.source: After the update is downloaded and staged, the device checks to see if it’s a good time to install the update.
segment.target: After the update is downloaded and staged, the device checks to see if it’s a good time to install the update.

segment.source: For non-SD card updates, the battery must be more than 30% charged.
segment.target: For non-SD card updates, the battery must be more than 30% charged.

segment.source: For SD updates, the battery must be more than 60% charged.
segment.target: For SD updates, the battery must be more than 60% charged.

segment.source: Next, it asks the user if it’s a good time to install the update.
segment.target: Next, it asks the user if it’s a good time to install the update.

segment.source: Here’s what they’ll see:
segment.target: Here’s what they’ll see:

segment.source: Normal updates
segment.target: Normal updates

segment.source: Strongly suggested updates
segment.target: Strongly suggested updates

segment.source: Mandatory updates
segment.target: Mandatory updates

segment.source: You write the notification when submitting the update.
segment.target: You write the notification when submitting the update.

segment.source: For small updates, we recommend a simple, encouraging description, like this:
segment.target: For small updates, we recommend a simple, encouraging description, like this:

segment.source: This update can help your device work better.
segment.target: This update can help your device work better.

segment.source: If there is an error during the install, the update stage goes back to scan for updates and starts again.
segment.target: If there is an error during the install, the update stage goes back to scan for updates and starts again.

segment.source: When the user decides to install the updates, the device reboots into the Update OS and completes the installation process.
segment.target: When the user decides to install the updates, the device reboots into the Update OS and completes the installation process.

segment.source: During the installation, spinning gears are shown to indicate progress by the Update OS.
segment.target: During the installation, spinning gears are shown to indicate progress by the Update OS.

segment.source: Manifest files, which contain information about the installed OS, are updated to reflect the contents of the update packages.
segment.target: Manifest files, which contain information about the installed OS, are updated to reflect the contents of the update packages.

segment.source: This allows for their use when the device is reset.
segment.target: This allows for their use when the device is reset.

segment.source: For more information about device resetting, see Updates and resetting the phone.
segment.target: For more information about device resetting, see Updates and resetting the phone.

segment.source: After the update OS reboots into the main OS, the user’s data is migrated and a progress bar is shown.
segment.target: After the update OS reboots into the main OS, the user’s data is migrated and a progress bar is shown.

segment.source: After the data migration is completed, a notification that indicates whether the update succeeded or failed is shown.
segment.target: After the data migration is completed, a notification that indicates whether the update succeeded or failed is shown.

segment.source: diagram of the update process
segment.target: diagram of the update process

segment.source: Troubleshooting
segment.target: Troubleshooting

segment.source: If an error occurs while staging an update, the device won’t schedule the install.
segment.target: If an error occurs while staging an update, the device won’t schedule the install.

segment.source: If an error happens during an operating system update (user sees spinning gears), and the update is not successful, then the device will not show an “Update complete” message.
segment.target: If an error happens during an operating system update (user sees spinning gears), and the update is not successful, then the device will not show an “Update complete” message.

segment.source: The device boots back to the main OS and starts the process again, beginning with checking for updates.
segment.target: The device boots back to the main OS and starts the process again, beginning with checking for updates.

segment.source: If an install is scheduled, it may skip the install and reschedules for the next day in the following circumstances:
segment.target: If an install is scheduled, it may skip the install and reschedules for the next day in the following circumstances:

segment.source: The user is using the device 5 minutes before the preferred install time.
segment.target: The user is using the device 5 minutes before the preferred install time.

segment.source: There is an incoming or outgoing call in action at the preferred install time.
segment.target: There is an incoming or outgoing call in action at the preferred install time.

segment.source: The user hasn’t received a notification that an update is ready to install.
segment.target: The user hasn’t received a notification that an update is ready to install.

segment.source: We try sending this reminder 8 hours ahead and keep retrying until 1 hour before the preferred install time.
segment.target: We try sending this reminder 8 hours ahead and keep retrying until 1 hour before the preferred install time.

segment.source: The user only sees the notification once.
segment.target: The user only sees the notification once.

segment.source: They may not see this notification if the device is off.
segment.target: They may not see this notification if the device is off.

segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: Submit an update
